content: NEW YORK Several top investors in Twenty-First Century Fox Inc are pressing for the right to swap their voting shares for ordinary shares  which are trading at an unusual premium  even though the move could hand even more control of the company to Rupert Murdoch  according to people familiar with the matter.
name: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc
title: Exclusive: Top Fox investors seek to convert voting shares  Murdoch may benefit - sources

content: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc's quarterly profit beat analysts' estimates  helped by higher affiliate and advertising revenue in its cable business and the box-office success of "The Maze Runner" and "Gone Girl".
name: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc
title: Cable business  films help Fox beat estimates

content: Feb 4 Twenty-First Century Fox Inc's  quarterly profit beat analysts' estimates  helped by higher affiliate and advertising revenue in its cable business and the box-office success of "The Maze Runner" and "Gone Girl".
name: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Cable business  films help Fox beat estimates

content: DUBAI Saudi Arabia's Kingdom Holding   the investment firm owned by billionaire Prince Alwaleed bin Talal  sold most of its stake in media giant News Corp  as part of a portfolio review  it said on Wednesday.
name: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc
title: Saudi's Kingdom Holding sells 5.6 percent stake in News Corp

content: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc cut its profit forecast for the next financial year after the dollar strengthened and as more viewers and advertisers swap its broadcast networks for on-demand TV. | Video

title: Fox says dollar  shifting viewers to weigh on 2016 profit

content: Feb 4 Twenty-First Century Fox Inc cut its profit forecast for the next financial year after the dollar strengthened and as more viewers and advertisers swap its broadcast networks for on-demand TV.

content: The United States Department of Justice has decided not to prosecute News Corp  or its sister company Twenty-First Century Fox  after completing an investigation of scandals in Great Britain involving phone hacking and alleged bribery of public officials.
name: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc
title: Justice Department drops News Corp probe related to phone hacking

content: A U.S. judge has rejected portions of Twenty-First Century Fox Inc's lawsuit seeking to stop Dish Network Corp from selling devices that let viewers skip over commercials when playing back shows.
